intro: Siphocampylus umbellatus var. wettsteinii, commonly known as the Wettstein's bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, which are often tinged with reddish or purple hues. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or open habitats. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive and ornamental species within the Campanulaceae family.
